snippet: Housing starts, however, lagged, coming in nearly at a rate well below November’s recent peak.
abstract: Industrial production rises at a faster-than-expected clip in March, providing another sign that the American economy is gaining momentum; groundbreaking for new homes also increased, but remains well below the post-recession peak hit in November 2013; Commerce Dept reports that housing starts are down 5.9 percent, compared with March 2013, biggest decline since April 2011.
lead_paragraph: Housing starts, however, lagged, coming in nearly at a rate well below November’s recent peak.

headline.main: Industrial Output Climbs, and New-Home Starts Tick Up
headline.print_headline: Industrial Output Climbs, and New-Home Starts Tick Up
